questions.question: What excites you most about technology?

options.label: Creating beautiful interfaces and user experiences
Uncovering patterns and insights in data
Protecting systems and preventing cyber threats
Building systems that solve problems automatically

questions.question: How do you prefer to work?

options.label: In teams with lots of communication and brainstorming
Independently with deep concentration
With a mix of solo work and team collaboration
Leading projects and guiding others

questions.question: What type of problems do you enjoy solving?

options.label: Creative challenges that require innovative thinking
Logical puzzles and systematic problem-solving
Problems that help people and improve their lives
Complex technical challenges with multiple variables

questions.question: What motivates you most in your work?

options.label: Making a meaningful impact on users or society
Continuous learning and mastering new skills
Recognition and advancement opportunities
Job security and stable income
I'm comfortable with uncertainty and enjoy exploring possibilities
I prefer clear requirements and structured approaches
I adapt well to changing situations
I ask questions to clarify requirements before proceeding
By doing and building projects
Through reading documentation and tutorials
By watching videos and following along
Through mentorship and guidance from others

questions.question: When you encounter a difficult problem, you typically:

options.label: Keep trying until you figure it out
Research and look up solutions online
Ask for help from peers or mentors
Break it down into smaller, manageable parts

questions.question: How do you stay updated with technology trends?

options.label: Check tech news and blogs daily
Set aside time weekly to explore new technologies
Learn new things as needed for projects
Follow a structured learning plan or course
Fully remote with flexible hours
Mix of remote and office work
Traditional office environment
Fast-paced startup environment
I finish tasks well before deadlines
I consistently meet deadlines
I work best under pressure
I prefer flexible timelines and iterative delivery

questions.question: If you had to choose, would you rather:

options.label: Build the user interface that people interact with
Build the systems that power applications behind the scenes
Work on both frontend and backend aspects
Focus deeply on one specialized area

questions.question: A critical system goes down. Your first reaction is to:

options.label: Systematically diagnose the problem
Communicate with stakeholders about the issue
Implement a quick fix to restore service
Analyze logs and data to understand the root cause

questions.question: You're asked to implement a feature you've never built before. You:

options.label: Research similar implementations and best practices first
Start with a simple prototype to test your approach
Consult with colleagues who have experience in this area
Start building and learn as you go

questions.question: Your team is behind schedule on a project. You would:

options.label: Reassess scope and prioritize essential features
Increase effort and work longer hours
Request additional resources or team members
Communicate transparently with stakeholders about the delay

questions.question: You notice a potential security vulnerability in a system. You:

options.label: Report it immediately to the security team
Investigate further to understand the full scope
Document the issue and propose a fix
Test if it can be exploited before reporting
